snippet: Relief workers saved more than 200 people from the rubble of dozens of villages that were destroyed after two earthquakes struck Saturday.
abstract: Relief workers save more than 200 people from the rubble of dozens of villages in Iran that were destroyed by two earthquakes; at least 300 people are reported dead and more than 4,500 injured, some severely, after two quakes, one with a magnitude of 6.4, strike in a wide area north of Tabriz.
lead_paragraph: Relief workers saved more than 200 people from the rubble of dozens of villages that were destroyed after two earthquakes struck Saturday.

headline.main: 200 Rescued in Iran After Quakes; Death Toll Rises to 300
headline.print_headline: 200 Rescued in Iran After Quakes; Death Toll Rises to 300
